complexity.technical: 2: Cleanup of unused code and verification of working systems
complexity.business: 3: Critical project cleanup after OS reinstall to maintain development velocity

outcomes.performance_impact: Reduced codebase size by removing 2 unused React applications

summary: Two unused React applications causing build errors and confusion about which UI is active â†’ Clean removal of chat-react and ide-dashboard, clarified that vanilla JS UI in src/ui/modules is the actual running interface
root_cause: Previous attempts to build React-based UIs were abandoned in favor of vanilla JS, but the React code remained causing dependency issues and build confusion

solution.approach: Identify unused React apps, verify no extension dependencies, remove folders and npm scripts, document actual UI architecture
key_changes: src/ui/app/chat-react: Removed entire unused React chat UI folder
src/ui/app/ui/ide-dashboard: Removed entire unused React dashboard folder
package.json: Removed build:chat-react, dev:chat-react, build:react, dev:react scripts
package.json: Updated compile script to remove build:react reference

validation: Directory listings confirmed folders removed, grep searches confirmed no references in package.json, memory search confirmed vanilla JS UI is actual running interface (EventBus, Logger, MessageTransport)

gotchas.issue: Initial confusion about which UI system was actually running - React or vanilla JS
gotchas.solution: Used memory search to find previous session notes about UI architecture, confirmed vanilla JS in src/ui/modules is the active system

gotchas.issue: Compile script still referenced removed build:react command
gotchas.solution: Found reference via grep after initial removal, updated compile script to remove build:react

lesson: When maintaining a project over time, unused experimental code should be removed promptly to avoid confusion. Memory system proved invaluable for understanding past architectural decisions after OS reinstall.

key_patterns: Memory search - Used to understand which UI system is actually running
Grep verification - Ensuring all references removed after deletion
Directory structure analysis - Understanding codebase organization

next_logical_steps: Continue development on vanilla JS UI in src/ui/modules
Consider documenting UI architecture in README to prevent future confusion
Periodically audit for unused experimental code

architecture_decisions.vanilla_js_ui: Extension uses vanilla JS UI (src/ui/modules, templates) not React - proven stable and working
architecture_decisions.react_removal: React experiments abandoned, code removed to reduce complexity and dependency issues

extension_points: src/ui/modules - Core UI logic controllers and managers
src/ui/templates - HTML templates for UI components
